ext_descriptions.ext_description: An type is an enumeration of the classes of flow equations.
the full potential flow.
the Euler flow.
the Navier-Stokes laminar flow.
the Navier-Stokes turbulent flow.
the Navier-Stokes laminar incrompressible flow.
the Navier-Stokes turbulent incrompressible flow.
A is an enumeration of standardized force and moment data.
A is an enumeration of the standard data names that may be associated with data corresponding to different kinds of gaseous state models.
indicates the ideal gas constant.
indicates the ratio of the specific heats at constant pressure to constant volume.
indicates the specific heat at constant pressure.
indicates the specific heat at constant volume.
A is an enumeration of the gaseous state models relating pressure, temperature and density.
the state model is unspecified.
the state model is specified via an external agreement between the data creator and the data user.
the state model is the perfect gas law.
the state model is Van der Waals' equation.
An mbna governing equation type is an enumeration of the classes of equations.
the equation type is unspecified.
the equation type is specified via an external agreement between the data creator and the data user.
A is an enumeration of the standard data names that may be associated with data corresponding to different kinds of thermal conductivity models.
the data name is indicates a power law exponent
the data name indicates a reference temperature.
the data name indicates a reference thermal conductivity.
the data name indicates Sutherland's Law constant for thermal conductivity.
the data name indicates a Prandtl number.
is an enumeration of the relationships between the thermal-conductivity coefficient and temperature.
the model type is unspecified.
the model type is is specified via an external agreement between the data creator and the data user.

the model type identifies that the thermal conductivity coefficient is independent of the temperature and is equal to some reference. The standard data name identifier associated with this model is thermal conductivity reference.

the model type the thermal conductivity is related to temperature via a power-law. The standard data name identifiers associated with this model are: power law exponent, temperature reference and thermal conductivity reference.
the standard data name identifiers associated with this model are: Sutherland constant - conductivity, temperature reference and thermal conductivity reference.
the Prandtl number (Pr = ?cp/k) is constant and equal to some reference value.
A is an enumeration of the standard data names that may be associated with data corresponding to different kinds of turbulence enclosures.
the data name indicates an eddy viscosity.
the data name indicates a Prandtl turbulent number.
A is an enumeration of the kinds of turbulence closure for the Reynolds stress terms of the Navier-Stokes equations.
the type is unspecified.
the type is specified via an external agreement between the data creator and the data user.
the Boussinesq eddy-velocity closure. The Reynolds stresses are approximated as the product of an eddy viscosity and the mean strain tensor.
the type has no approximation of the Reynolds stresses.
the type is an algebraic approximation for the Reynolds stresses based on some intermediate transport quantities.
A is an enumeration of standardized Reynolds-averaged Navier- Stokes turbulence model variables.
A is an enumeration of the equation sets for modeling the turbulence quantities.
the model type is unspecified.
the type is specified via an external agreement between the data creator and the data user.
the type is Baldwin-Lomax.
the type is Cebeci-Smith.
the type is Johnson-King.
the type is Baldwin-Barth.
the type is Spalart-Allmaras.
the type is Jones-Launder.
the type is Menter SST.
the type is Wilcox.
A is an enumeration of the standard data names that may be associated with data corresponding to different kinds of viscosity models.
the data name indicates a molecular viscosity reference;
the data name indicates Sutherland's constant for Sutherland's Law for molecular viscosity.
A is an enumeration of the relationships between molecular viscosity and temperature.
the type is unspecified.
the type is specified via an external agreement between the data creator and the data user.
the molecular viscosity is constant throughout the field and is equal to some reference value

the viscosity model is related to temperature via a power-law. The standard data name identifiers associated with this model are: power law exponent, temperature reference and thermal conductivity reference.
the model type is Sutherland's Law for molecular viscosity.
An is a type of which includes diffusion.
describes the viscous diffusion terms modelled in the flow equations, and is applicable only to Navier-Stokes equations.
An is the viscous diffusion terms modelled in the flow equations, and is applicable only to Navier-Stokes equations.
the diffusion terms.
the number of elements in the terms array. For 1-D this is one, for 2-D it is three, and for 3-D it is six.
An is a type of describing the class of governing flow equations associated with the solution.
the type of equation.
A Flow_equation_set is a type of set providing a general description of governing flow equations. It includes the dimensionality of the governing equations.

ul.li: the auxiliary relations for molecular viscosity;
the turbulent closure for Reynolds-averaged Navier-Stokes equations;
the turbulence model for Reynolds-averaged Navier-Stokes equations.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the general class of CFD equations
A is a type of that is the equation of state model used in the governing equations to relate pressure, temperature and density.
the particular gaseous equation of state model.
A is a type of that is a model for relating physical or mathematical quantities
the data.
An is a type of that represents the concept of a mathematical formulation of a physics phenonema.
An is a type of that gives a general description of governing equations. It includes the dimensionality of the governing equations.
the dimensionality of the governing equations; it is the number of spatial variables describing the equation.
the general class of equations.
zero or more behavioural models.
An is a type of describing the class of governing equations associated with the analysis solution.
the kind of equation.

A Thermal_conductivity_model is a type of
that is the model for relating the thermal-conductivity coefficient (k) to temperature.
the particular thermal conductivity model type.
A is a type of that is the turbulence closure for the Reynolds stress terms of the Navier-Stokes equations.
the particular turbulence closure type.
A is a type of that is the equation set used to model the turbulence quantities.
the particular turbulence model type.
the description of the viscous diffusion terms included in the turbulent transport model equations. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
A is a type of is the model for relating molecular viscosity (?) to temperature.
the particular viscosity model type.
